intro: Dicliptera maculata subsp. pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white florets arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It typically thrives in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in botanical research.
